Section.Text: The quantity of CO2 emissions attributed to the production of useful thermal energy by a unit during a calendar year is determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the net quantity of useful thermal energy, expressed in GJ, determined by the formula

ImageGroup.AlternateText: The sum of the products of houti and Mouti for each heat stream “i” minus the sum of the products of hinj and Minj for each heat stream “j”, summed for all time periods.

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the tth period, where “t” goes from 1 to x and where x is the total number of periods during which the unit produced useful thermal energy during the calendar year,
is the ith heat stream exiting the unit, where “i” goes from 1 to n and where n is the total number of heat streams exiting the unit,

is the average specific enthalpy of the ith heat stream exiting the unit during period “t”, expressed in GJ/tonne and determined based on the measurement, using a continuous measuring device, of the temperature and pressure of that heat stream,
is the mass flow of the ith heat stream exiting the unit during period “t”, expressed in tonnes and determined using a continuous measuring device,
is the jth heat stream, other than condensate return, entering the unit, where “j” goes from 1 to m and where m is the total number of heat streams entering the unit,

is the average specific enthalpy of the jth heat stream, other than condensate return, entering the unit during period “t”, expressed in GJ/tonne and determined based on the measurement, using a continuous measuring device, of the temperature and pressure of that heat stream, and
is the mass flow of the jth heat stream, other than condensate return, entering the unit during period “t”, expressed in tonnes and determined using a continuous measuring device; and
is the emission intensity of a reference boiler, set to 0.0556 tonnes of CO2 emissions per GJ.

Section.Text: The quantity of CO2 emissions attributed to electricity generated by a unit that is used internally, during a calendar year, at the facility where the unit is located is determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the quantity of electricity generated by the unit that is used internally, during the calendar year, at the facility where the unit is located, expressed in GWh and determined by the formula

is the sum of the total gross electricity generated by each unit at the facility that is subject to an emission limit under subsection 9(1) during the calendar year, expressed in GWh and measured for each unit at the electrical terminals of the unit’s generators,
is the net supply from the facility for the calendar year, and
is the total gross electricity generated by the unit during the calendar year, expressed in GWh and measured at the electrical terminals of the unit’s generators; and
is the emission intensity of a reference unit that produces useful thermal energy, set to 250 tonnes of CO2 emissions per GWh.

Subsection.Text: The quantity of CO2 from a unit that is captured during a calendar year and stored in a storage project is determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the value determined for Eu in subsection 12(1) or, if applicable, subsection 27(1);

is the quantity of CO2 that is the portion of Ein that has been captured and subsequently stored, during the calendar year, in a storage project that meets the conditions set out in subsection (2), expressed in tonnes and determined by means of a direct measuring device that measures the flow and concentration of CO2; and

is the quantity of CO2, expressed in tonnes, entering the carbon capture and storage system during the calendar year, determined, in accordance with sections 7.1 to 7.5 of the CEMS Protocol, using a CEMS that is located upstream of the carbon capture and storage system and that measures all CO2 entering the carbon capture and storage system.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of determining the value for Eccs in subsections 12(1) and 27(1), a quantity of CO2 may only be claimed if it has been permanently stored in a storage project that meets the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the geological site into which the CO2 is injected is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a deep saline aquifer into which the CO2 is injected for the sole purpose of storing it, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a depleted oil reservoir into which the CO2 is injected for the purpose of enhanced oil recovery; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the CO2 stored for the purposes of the project is captured, transported and stored in accordance with the laws of Canada or a province or the laws of the United States or one of its states.

Subsection.Text: The quantity of CO2 emissions from the production of the hydrogen, ammonia or steam used by a unit to generate electricity during a calendar year is determined by the formula

ImageGroup.AlternateText: The sum of the multiplication of Qk by the quotient of Ek and Pk, summed for each stream “k” of hydrogen, ammonia and steam.

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the kth stream of hydrogen, ammonia or steam, where “k” goes from 1 to n and where n is the number of streams of hydrogen, ammonia or steam that are used by the unit during the calendar year;
is the total annual CO2 emissions, expressed in tonnes, from the total annual production of the kth stream of hydrogen, ammonia or steam used by the unit during the calendar year;
is the total annual production of the kth stream of hydrogen, ammonia or steam during the calendar year, determined using a continuous measuring device and expressed

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: in m3 at standard conditions, in the case of hydrogen and ammonia, and

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: in GJ, in the case of steam; and

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the quantity of hydrogen or ammonia, expressed in m3 at standard conditions, or the quantity of purchased or transferred steam, expressed in GJ, in the kth stream used by the unit to generate electricity during the calendar year, determined using a continuous measuring device.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), the responsible person must obtain the values of Ek and Pk from the supplier of the hydrogen, ammonia or steam, if any, used by the unit, determined in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: section 10 of the GHGRP, in the case of hydrogen production;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: section 8 of the GHGRP, in the case of ammonia production; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: section 7 of the GHGRP, in the case of steam production.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (2)(a), the description of RCO2 in Equation 10-2 of the GHGRP is to be read as “CO2 captured and permanently stored in a storage project that meets the conditions set out in subsection 23(2) of the Clean Electricity Regulations”.

If the hydrogen or ammonia used by a unit is not produced at the facility at which the unit is located or the steam used by a unit is purchased or transferred to that facility and the responsible person for the unit is not able to obtain from the supplier the information required under subsection (2), the responsible person must replace the ratio Ek ÷ Pk in subsection (1) with the following values:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 9.8312 × 10-4 tonnes of CO2/m3, in the case of hydrogen;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 1.4635 × 10-3 tonnes of CO2/m3, in the case of ammonia; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 0.08 tonnes of CO2/GJ, in the case of steam.

Subsection.Text: The responsible person for a unit may, for the purposes of subsection 12(1), deduct the quantity of CO2 emissions attributed to the unit during a deduction period and may, for the purposes of subsection 13(2), deduct the quantity of electricity generated by the unit during a deduction period if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the electricity system operator has determined that there is an irresistible emergency event, whether natural or arising from human action, or the Minister has determined that there is a risk to human health and safety;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an irresistible emergency event, the event is outside the control of the electricity system operator and the responsible person;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the electricity system operator has determined that the event or risk referred to in paragraph (a) has triggered a disruption or significant risk of disruption to the electricity supply in the province in which the unit is located or in a contiguous province or state;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the electricity system operator directs the unit to generate electricity due to the event or risk referred to in paragraph (a) in order to alleviate or materially help alleviate a disruption or significant risk of disruption to the electricity supply in the province in which the unit is located or in a contiguous province or state;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the generation of electricity by the unit will alleviate or materially help alleviate a disruption or significant risk of disruption to the electricity supply in the province in which the unit is located or in a contiguous province or state; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: within seven days after the day on which the direction to generate electricity referred to in paragraph (d) is received, the responsible person notifies the Minister of that direction.

Subsection.Text: The period for which the quantities of CO2 emissions and electricity generated may be deducted begins in the hour in which a unit operates in response to the direction to generate electricity referred to in paragraph (1)(d) and ends as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if an application for an extension of the deduction period is not submitted to the Minister in accordance with subsection 26(1), the period ends on the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the day that is the 30th day after the day on which the direction to generate electricity was given, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the hour that is 24 hours after the electricity system operator notifies the responsible person for the unit that the direction to generate electricity no longer applies; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an application for an extension of the deduction period is submitted to the Minister in accordance with subsection 26(1), the period ends

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an application that is not granted, on the earlier of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the hour that is 24 hours after the electricity system operator notifies the responsible person for the unit that the direction to generate electricity no longer applies, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the day that is the 45th day after the day on which the direction to generate electricity was given, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, on the earlier of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the hour that is 24 hours after the electricity system operator notifies the responsible person for the unit that the direction to generate electricity no longer applies, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the hour that is 24 hours after the Minister notifies the responsible person for the unit that the deduction period has ended.

Subsection.Text: The responsible person must, within seven days after the day on which the electricity system operator notifies the responsible person that the direction to generate electricity referred to in paragraph (1)(d) no longer applies, notify the Minister that the direction no longer applies.

Section.MarginalNote: Application for extension of deduction period

Subsection.Text: If the conditions set out in subsection 25(1) will continue to be met for more than 30 days after the day on which the unit receives the direction to generate electricity referred to in paragraph 25(1)(d), the responsible person may, within 30 days after the day on which the direction is received, apply to the Minister for an extension of the deduction period.
The application must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number assigned to the unit by the Minister under subsection 7(3), if any;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which and hour at which the deduction period began;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the irresistible emergency event or risk to human health and safety that caused the electricity system operator to direct the unit to generate electricity, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which and hour at which the event or risk began and, if applicable, the date on which and hour at which it ended,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the province or state in which the event or risk occurred,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the province or state in which the disruption or significant risk of disruption to the electricity supply occurred, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: information demonstrating that the unit received the direction to generate electricity to alleviate or materially help alleviate a disruption or significant risk of disruption to the electricity supply; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the direction to generate electricity is due to the electricity system operator determining that there is an irresistible emergency event, information, along with supporting documents, demonstrating that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the electricity system operator determined that an irresistible emergency event occurred,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the event was outside the control of the electricity system operator and the responsible person for the unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the irresistible emergency event caused the disruption or significant risk of disruption to the electricity supply that the direction to generate electricity is intended to alleviate or materially help alleviate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the disruption or significant risk of disruption to the electricity supply arising from the event will continue for more than 30 days after the day on which the deduction period began.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister is satisfied that the conditions set out in subsection 25(1) will continue to be met, the Minister must, within 10 days after the day on which the application is received, grant an extension of the deduction period.
Before granting an extension of a deduction period based on an irresistible emergency event, the Minister must be satisfied that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the event occurred;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the event is outside the control of the electricity system operator and the responsible person for the unit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the disruption or significant risk of disruption to the electricity supply arising from the event will continue; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the generation of electricity by the unit will alleviate or materially help alleviate the disruption or significant risk of disruption to the electricity supply in the province in which the unit is located or in a contiguous province or state.

Subsection.Text: The quantity referred to in the description of Eec in subsection 12(1) is determined by the formula

ImageGroup.AlternateText: The sum, for each deduction period “i”, of Eu minus Eth, minus Eint, minus Eccs, plus Eext.

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the ith deduction period, where “i” goes from 1 to n and where n is the number of deduction periods in the calendar year;

is the quantity of CO2 emissions, expressed in tonnes, from the combustion of fossil fuel in the unit during the ith deduction period during the calendar year, determined in accordance with subsection 12(3);

is the quantity of CO2 emissions, expressed in tonnes, attributed to the production of useful thermal energy by the unit during the ith deduction period during the calendar year, determined in accordance with section 21;

is the quantity of CO2 emissions, expressed in tonnes, attributed to electricity generated by the unit, during the ith deduction period during the calendar year, that is used internally at the facility where the unit is located and is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: equal to zero, in the case of

FormulaParagraph.Label: (i)
FormulaParagraph.Text: any deduction period in which the unit did not produce useful thermal energy,

FormulaParagraph.Label: (ii)
FormulaParagraph.Text: any unit, other than a planned unit, that has a commissioning date after December 31, 2024, and

FormulaParagraph.Label: (iii)
FormulaParagraph.Text: every deduction period after 2049, and

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: determined in accordance with section 22 in any other case;

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the quantity of CO2, expressed in tonnes, captured from the unit during the ith deduction period during the calendar year and stored in a storage project, determined in accordance with section 23; and

is the quantity of CO2 emissions, expressed in tonnes, from the production of the hydrogen, ammonia and the purchased or transferred steam used by the unit to generate electricity during the ith deduction period during the calendar year, determined in accordance with section 24.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), any reference to a calendar year in a calculation required under section 15 or 16 or any of sections 19 to 24 is to be read as a reference to the applicable deduction period.

If a deduction period begins in one calendar year and ends in another calendar year, the deduction period for the purposes of subsection (1) is the portion of that deduction period that occurred during the calendar year for which CO2 emissions are being determined.
A quantity of CO2 emissions must not be included in more than one deduction period for the purposes of subsection (1).

The quantity of CO2 assigned to Coff in subsection 12(1) corresponds to the number of Canadian offset credits that the responsible person remits to the Minister for the unit on or before the December 15 that follows the calendar year for which the remittance is made.
The maximum number of Canadian offset credits that may be remitted for a unit for a calendar year corresponds to the quantity of CO2, expressed in tonnes, determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the unit’s electricity generation capacity for the calendar year; and
is the emission intensity applicable to the calendar year and is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (a)
FormulaParagraph.Text: 35 tonnes of CO2 emissions per GWh for the 2035 to 2049 calendar years, and

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: 42 tonnes of CO2 emissions per GWh for the 2050 and subsequent calendar years.

Subsection.Text: The quantity determined under subsection (2) is to be rounded to the nearest whole number or, if equidistant between two consecutive whole numbers, to the higher number.

Any Canadian offset credit remitted for a calendar year must have been issued for greenhouse gas reductions or removals that occurred no more than eight calendar years before the calendar year in which the Canadian offset credit is remitted.

A responsible person may remit the same Canadian offset credit for the purposes of both subsection 12(1) and an eligible system referred to in subsection (6) if, under that eligible system, the Canadian offset credit is remitted

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the same calendar year as the year for which the Canadian offset credit is remitted under this section;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in relation to the same unit for which the Canadian offset credit is remitted under this section; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in fulfillment of a remittance requirement other than a requirement that relates to an extraordinary situation, such as to replace a cancelled credit or as compensation for non-compliance with a requirement.

Subsection.Text: The eligible systems are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a system for pricing greenhouse gas emissions established under Division 1 of Part 2 of the Greenhouse Gas Pollution Pricing Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a provincial carbon pricing system that is subject to an agreement between the Minister and a province regarding the cross-recognition of Canadian offset credits and that is on the list published on the Department of the Environment’s website for the purposes of this section.

Subsection.Text: A Canadian offset credit is considered to be remitted on the day on which a reconciliation report that contains all of the information set out in sections 1 and 2 of Schedule 6 in respect of the Canadian offset credit is submitted to the Minister in accordance with section 41.

If, within five years after the day on which a responsible person remits to the Minister one or more Canadian offset credits referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition Canadian offset credit in subsection 2(1), the issuing province cancels and does not provide a mechanism to replace the credits, the Minister must notify the responsible person of the number of Canadian offset credits that were cancelled by the province and the number of Canadian offset credits that the responsible person must remit to the Minister.

If the Minister determines that one or more Canadian offset credits referred to in subsection 28(5) were remitted that did not meet the conditions set out in that subsection, the Minister must notify the responsible person of the number of Canadian offset credits remitted that did not meet those conditions and the number of Canadian offset credits that the responsible person must remit to the Minister.

The responsible person must provide to the Minister, within the time limit specified by the Minister, any information requested by the Minister to determine whether a Canadian offset credit meets the conditions set out in subsection 28(5).

The responsible person must remit the number of Canadian offset credits set out in a notice referred to in subsection (1) or (2) by submitting to the Minister, no later than December 15 of the calendar year that follows the calendar year in which the Minister provides the notice, a reconciliation report that contains the information set out in sections 1 and 4 of Schedule 6 in respect of the credits.

The Canadian offset credits that are remitted under subsection (4) must have been issued for greenhouse gas reductions or removals that occurred no more than eight calendar years before the time limit set out in that subsection.

If the Minister is satisfied that, for any of the 2035 to 2049 calendar years, the quantity of CO2 emissions attributed to a unit, as determined in accordance with the formula set out in the description of E in subsection 12(1), is below the emission limit determined for the unit in accordance with subsection 9(1), the Minister must issue to the responsible person for the unit, for that calendar year and for that unit, a number of compliance credits, each with a corresponding value of one tonne of CO2, that is equal to the difference between that quantity and that limit.
Despite subsection (1), no compliance credits are issued for a unit for a calendar year if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the unit is not subject to an emission limit under subsection 9(1) before July 1 of that calendar year; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the unit is subject to an exemption, under subsection 14(1), from the application of subsection 9(1) for that calendar year.

Subsection.Text: The responsible person for a unit must provide to the Minister, within the time limit specified by the Minister, any information requested by the Minister that is necessary to determine whether

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of CO2 emissions assigned to E in subsection 12(1) that is reported in the emissions report submitted under section 39 for the unit for a calendar year was determined in accordance with that subsection; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the emission limit that is reported in the emissions report submitted under section 39 for the unit for a calendar year was determined in accordance with subsection 9(1).

Subsection.Text: If, after receiving the information requested under subsection (3), the Minister is not satisfied that the quantity of CO2 emissions attributed to a unit, as determined in accordance with the formula set out in the description of E in subsection 12(1), is below the emission limit determined for the unit in accordance with subsection 9(1), the Minister must notify the responsible person that no compliance credits will be issued for the unit for the calendar year.
Subject to section 32, the compliance credits issued under subsection 30(1) for a unit for a calendar year are transferable if the unit does not combust coal during the calendar year and is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a unit that has a commissioning date before January 1, 2025 and that does not produce useful thermal energy during the calendar year;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a unit, other than a planned unit, that has a commissioning date after December 31, 2024 but before January 1, 2030; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a planned unit that does not produce useful thermal energy during the calendar year.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 32, the compliance credits issued under subsection 30(1) for a unit for a calendar year are non-transferable if the unit is not a unit referred to in subsection (1).
A transferable compliance credit may only be transferred between responsible persons for units to which these Regulations apply.

The responsible person for a unit described in any of paragraphs 31(1)(a) to (c) or a unit that has been designated as a substitute unit under this section may, with the agreement of the responsible person for another unit, designate that other unit as a substitute unit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the electricity generation capacity of the unit being designated as a substitute unit does not exceed the electricity generation capacity of the unit being substituted; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: both units report to the same electricity system operator.

Subsection.Text: To designate a substitute unit, the responsible person that makes the designation and the responsible person for the unit that will be designated as a substitute unit must each submit the following information to the Minister before January 1 of the calendar year in which the substitution will take effect, along with an attestation, dated and signed by the responsible person or its authorized official, that it agrees to the substitution:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number assigned to each unit by the Minister under subsection 7(3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the electricity generation capacity of each unit; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the electricity system operator for each unit.

Subsection.Text: Beginning with the calendar year in which the designation of a substitute unit takes effect,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any compliance credits issued for the substitute unit for that calendar year — and for any subsequent calendar year in which the unit is a substitute unit — are transferable, unless the substitute unit

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: combusts coal during that calendar year,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has a commissioning date before January 1, 2025 and produces useful thermal energy during that calendar year, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is a planned unit that produces useful thermal energy during that calendar year; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any compliance credits issued for the unit that is not the substitute unit for that calendar year — and for any subsequent calendar year in which that unit is not a substitute unit — are non-transferable.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Ceasing to be a substitute unit
Subsection.Text: A substitute unit ceases to be a substitute unit on January 1 of the calendar year that follows the year in which the responsible person for that unit designates another substitute unit in accordance with this section.

The quantity of CO2 assigned to Cc in subsection 12(1) corresponds to the number of compliance credits that the responsible person remits to the Minister for the unit on or before the December 15 that follows the calendar year for which the remittance is made.
A responsible person may only remit a compliance credit for the purposes of subsection 12(1) if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the remittance is for a calendar year before 2050;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the compliance credit was issued for a calendar year that is no more than five calendar years before the calendar year in which it is remitted;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a non-transferable compliance credit, the credit is remitted for the unit for which it was issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a transferable compliance credit, the credit is remitted

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for a unit that

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: met, during the calendar year for which the remittance is made, the conditions to be issued transferable compliance credits that are set out in subsections 31(1) and 32(3), and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: reports to the same electricity system operator as the unit for which the transferable compliance credit was issued, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the unit for which it was issued.

Subsection.Text: A compliance credit is considered to be remitted on the day on which a reconciliation report that contains all of the information set out in sections 1 to 3 of Schedule 6 in respect of the compliance credit is submitted to the Minister in accordance with section 41.
A compliance credit remitted under these Regulations may only be remitted once and, once remitted to the Minister, is retired and must not be used again.
The value of the variables referred to in the formulas set out in subsection 20(1) and (4) must be determined based on fuel samples taken in accordance with this section.

Each fuel sample must be taken at a time and location in the fuel-handling system of the facility that provides the following representative samples of the fuel combusted at the applicable minimum frequency:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for natural gas, during each sampling period consisting of each calendar year that the unit generates electricity or produces useful thermal energy, two samples taken that year, with each of those samples being taken at least four months after any previous sample has been taken, in accordance with one of the following standards:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ASTM D4057, entitled Standard Practice for Manual Sampling of Petroleum and Petroleum Products,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ASTM D4177, entitled Standard Practice for Automatic Sampling of Petroleum and Petroleum Products, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: ASTM F307, entitled Standard Practice for Sampling Pressurized Gas for Gas Analysis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for refinery gas, during each sampling period consisting of each day that the unit generates electricity or produces useful thermal energy, one sample per day that is taken at least six hours after any previous sample has been taken, in accordance with any of the standards referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for a type of liquid fuel or of a gaseous fuel other than refinery gas and natural gas, during each sampling period consisting of each month that the unit generates electricity or produces useful thermal energy, one sample per month that is taken at least two weeks after any previous sample has been taken, in accordance with any of the standards referred to in paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for a solid fuel, one composite sample per month that consists of sub-samples, each having the same mass, that are taken

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: from the fuel that is fed for combustion during each week that begins in that month and during which the unit generates electricity or produces useful thermal energy,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: after all fuel treatment operations have been carried out but before any mixing of the fuel with other fuels, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: at intervals of at least 72 hours.

Subsection.Text: If the responsible person takes more samples or composite samples, as the case may be, than the number required under subsection (2) and a determination is made on the carbon content of any of those samples or composite samples in the manner set out in the description of CCi in subsection 20(4) for the fuel type, the results of that determination must be included in the determination of CCA under subsection 20(4).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Carbon content provided by the supplier
Subsection.Text: A responsible person may use the carbon content of a fuel provided by the supplier of the fuel rather than taking fuel samples in accordance with this section if the supplier

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: determined the carbon content in the manner set out in the description of CCi in subsection 20(4); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: took the samples during the applicable sampling period and at the applicable minimum sampling frequency set out in subsection (2).

Subsection.Text: If, for any reason beyond the responsible person’s control, the data required to determine the value of any variable in any formula in these Regulations is missing for a period of a calendar year, replacement data for that period must be used to determine that value.

If a CEMS is used to determine the value of a variable in a formula set out in section 16 or 17 or any of sections 7.1 to 7.5 of the CEMS Protocol, but data is missing for a given period, the replacement data must be obtained in accordance with section 3.4.1 of the CEMS Protocol.

If data, other than data referred to in subsection (2), that is required to determine the value of any variable in a formula in these Regulations is missing for a given period, the replacement data is to be the average of the available data for that variable during the equivalent period prior to and, if the data is available, subsequent to that given period. However, if no data is available for that variable for the equivalent period prior to that given period, the replacement data to be used is the value determined for that variable during the equivalent period subsequent to the given period.
Replacement data may be used for more than one period during a calendar year but must not be used for more than 672 hours during the calendar year.

Section.MarginalNote: Measuring devices — installation, maintenance and calibration

Subsection.Text: A responsible person must install, maintain and calibrate all measuring devices, other than a CEMS, that are used for the purposes of these Regulations in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions or any applicable generally recognized national or international industry standard.
The responsible person must calibrate each measuring device

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at least once in every calendar year and at least five months after a previous calibration; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at the minimum frequency recommended by the manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: The responsible person must use measuring devices that enable measurements to be made with an accuracy of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ± 3% in the case of any device used to measure a quantity of electricity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ± 5% in the case of any other device.

Subsection.Text: However, if a document incorporated by reference into these Regulations requires measurements that are more accurate than what is required by subsection (3), the responsible person must use a measuring device that enables measurements to be made with the degree of accuracy required by that document.

Section.Text: A responsible person must, as soon as feasible, notify the Minister of any error or omission in any information submitted in accordance with these Regulations and must submit to the Minister the corrected information no later than 120 days after the day on which the responsible person becomes aware of the error or omission.

Subsection.Text: A responsible person must submit to the Minister a corrected emissions report for a unit no later than 120 days after the day on which

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the responsible person submits a notice under section 37 that indicates that the responsible person has become aware of an error or omission that resulted in the issuance of an incorrect number of compliance credits for the unit; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister notifies the responsible person of an error or omission that resulted in the issuance of an incorrect number of compliance credits for the unit.

Subsection.Text: The corrected emissions report must contain the information set out in Schedule 5 for the same calendar year as the calendar year to which the error or omission relates, along with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information that required correction and a description of the corrections made;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the circumstances that led to the error or omission and an indication of the reasons why the error or omission was not previously detected; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measures that have been and will be implemented to avoid errors or omissions of the same type.

Subsection.Text: If, as a result of the error or omission, the number of compliance credits issued for a unit is greater than the number of compliance credits that would have been issued had the correct quantities been used to calculate that number at the time of issuance, the responsible person must remit to the Minister, no later than the December 15 that follows the time limit referred to in subsection (1), a number of compliance credits and, if applicable, Canadian offset credits that is equal to the difference between the number of compliance credits issued and the number that should have been issued.
The credits remitted for a unit for the purposes of subsection (3) must be, in the following order of precedence,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: compliance credits issued for the unit for the same calendar year as the calendar year to which the error or omission relates;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an insufficient number of compliance credits referred to in paragraph (a) are held by the responsible person to fulfill the remittance obligation, any other compliance credits that are held in respect of that unit on the day that the notice referred to in paragraph (1)(a) or (b) is provided; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if an insufficient number of compliance credits referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b) are held by the responsible person to fulfill the remittance obligation, any combination of transferable compliance credits and Canadian offset credits.

Subsection.Text: The responsible person may only remit compliance credits and Canadian offset credits for a unit for the purposes of this section if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of compliance credits, the credits were issued

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for a calendar year that is no more than five calendar years before the calendar year in which they are remitted, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for a unit that reports to the same electricity system operator as the unit for which they are remitted; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Canadian offset credits,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the credits were issued for greenhouse gas reductions or removals that occurred no more than eight calendar years before the calendar year in which they are remitted, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number remitted does not exceed the number that is equal to the difference between

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the sum of the maximum number of Canadian offset credits that may be remitted for the unit under section 28 for each calendar year beginning with the calendar year to which the error or omission relates and ending with the calendar year in which the credits are remitted, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the sum of the number of Canadian offset credits that have already been remitted for the unit for each of those calendar years.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (3), if a responsible person does not hold and is unable to obtain a sufficient number of compliance credits or Canadian offset credits that meet the conditions set out in subsections (4) and (5) to fulfill the remittance obligation by the time limit set out in subsection (3), the responsible person must remit the number of credits that it was able to obtain by that time limit and remit to the Minister the outstanding number of compliance credits or Canadian offset credits in the following calendar year — or, if it still does not hold and is unable to obtain a sufficient number of credits in that following calendar year, in a subsequent calendar year — in accordance with subsection (7).
Credits remitted for a unit after the time limit set out in subsection (3) must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: compliance credits issued for the unit; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an insufficient number of compliance credits referred to in paragraph (a) are held by the responsible person to fulfill the remittance obligation, any combination of transferable compliance credits or Canadian offset credits that the responsible person is able to obtain in that calendar year that meet the conditions set out in subsection (5).

Subsection.Text: Compliance credits and Canadian offset credits remitted under this section are considered to be remitted on the day on which a reconciliation report that contains all of the information set out in sections 1, 3 and 5 of Schedule 6 in respect of the credits is submitted to the Minister in accordance with section 41.

Beginning with the calendar year in which a unit becomes subject to an emission limit under subsection 9(1), the responsible person must submit to the Minister an annual emissions report for the unit that contains the information set out in Schedule 5.
The emissions report must be submitted on or before June 1 of the calendar year that follows the calendar year that is the subject of the report.

A responsible person must submit to the Minister — for each calendar year that the unit is subject to an exemption, under subsection 14(1), from the application of section 39 — a short emissions report for the unit that contains the information set out in sections 1, 2, 4 and 9 of Schedule 5.
The short emissions report must be submitted on or before June 1 of the calendar year that follows the calendar year that is the subject of the report.

Beginning with the calendar year in which a unit becomes subject to an emission limit under subsection 9(1), the responsible person must submit to the Minister an annual reconciliation report for the unit that contains the information set out in Schedule 6.
The reconciliation report must be submitted on or before December 15 of the calendar year that follows the calendar year that is the subject of the report.

If a compliance credit is held in respect of a unit for any portion of a calendar year and a reconciliation report is not required under subsection 41(1) in respect of the unit for that calendar year, the responsible person must submit to the Minister a short reconciliation report for the unit for that calendar year that contains the information set out in sections 1 and 3 of Schedule 6.
The short reconciliation report must be submitted on or before December 15 of the calendar year that follows the calendar year that is the subject of the report.

If a unit permanently ceases to generate electricity, the responsible person for the unit must, no later than 60 days after the day on which the unit permanently ceases generating electricity, submit to the Minister a notice of permanent cessation of electricity generation that contains the information set out in Schedule 7.
A responsible person that submits the notice referred to in subsection (1) must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: submit any report required under any of sections 39 to 42 in respect of the unit for the calendar year in which the unit permanently ceases to generate electricity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: continue to comply with the requirements set out in sections 29, 37, 38 and 44 to 48 in respect of the unit.

Subsection.Text: Any information that is required to be submitted under these Regulations, including any notice provided under subsection 8(5), paragraph 25(1)(f), subsection 25(3), section 37 or subsection 46(3), and any application that is made under these Regulations, must be submitted electronically in the form specified by the Minister and must bear the electronic signature of the responsible person or its authorized official.

If the Minister has not specified an electronic form or if the responsible person is unable to submit the information electronically in accordance with subsection (1) because of circumstances beyond the responsible person’s control, the information must be submitted on paper, signed by the responsible person or its authorized official, in the form specified by the Minister or, if no form has been specified, in any form.
A responsible person must make records containing the following documents and information with respect to the unit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any notice, attestation, declaration, application, report or information submitted to the Minister under these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the responsible person is required to make a determination or perform a calculation under these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the determination or calculation required,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the measurements on which the determination or calculation was based,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of the standard or method that was used to determine the value of any variable of a formula required to complete the calculations, as well as any information, including the methodology, that is used to determine that value, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any supporting documents for the information referred to in subparagraphs (i) to (iii);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if a quantity is assigned to Qa in subsection 13(2), the documentation referred to in paragraph 13(4)(c) and information demonstrating that useful thermal energy was supplied to a recipient facility;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of the standard or method used to determine the value of CCi in subsection 20(4) for a sample of gaseous fuel, including an indication of whether a direct measuring device was used to determine that value;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s instructions for any measuring device used to determine any value or quantity under these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: information demonstrating that the requirements set out in section 36 have been met;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: for each calendar year during which the responsible person uses a CEMS,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: information demonstrating that the requirements set out in the CEMS Protocol for the design, certification, operation and performance evaluation of the CEMS have been met,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: documents confirming that the CEMS certification requirement set out in subsection 18(2) has been met, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of each quality assurance plan developed for the CEMS and information demonstrating that the requirements set out in section 6 of the CEMS Protocol for the quality assurance plan have been met;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the results of the analysis of every sample taken for the purposes of subsections 20(1) or (4), as well as the date on which each sample was taken and an indication of the standards that were used to take representative samples of the fuel;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if a supplier of hydrogen, ammonia or steam has provided the values of Ek and Pk under subsection 24(2), the information provided by the supplier;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: if a supplier of fuel has provided the carbon content of that fuel under subsection 34(4), the information provided by the supplier;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: information demonstrating the manner in which the electricity generation capacity set out in any registration report submitted under section 7 or subsection 8(2) and each emissions report submitted under section 39 was determined; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: if replacement data was used under section 35, information demonstrating the reason replacement data was required, along with the replacement data that was used.

Subsection.Text: A record must be made no later than 30 days after the day on which the information and documents to be included in it become available.
A responsible person must keep the records that are required to be made under these Regulations with respect to the unit, along with the supporting documents, for the following periods:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a registration report submitted under subsection 7(1), paragraph 7(2)(a) or subsection 8(2) and any supporting documents related to that registration report, the period that begins on the day on which the registration report is submitted to the Minister and ends on the day that is seven years after the day on which the notice referred to in subsection 43(1) is submitted in respect of the unit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, a period of seven years after the later of the day on which the record is made and the day on which the information is submitted to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: The records and supporting documents must be kept at the responsible person’s principal place of business in Canada or at any other place in Canada where they can be inspected. If the records and documents are not kept at the responsible person’s principal place of business, the responsible person must provide the Minister with the civic address of the place where they are kept.
If the records and supporting documents are moved, the responsible person must notify the Minister of the civic address of the new location within 30 days after the day of the move.

Section.Text: A responsible person must provide to the Minister a copy of any record that is required to be kept no later than 30 days after the Minister requests it.

All documents required by these Regulations must be in English or French or be accompanied by a translation in English or French and an affidavit of the translator attesting to the accuracy of the translation.

Section.Text: The registration number, if any, assigned to the unit by the Minister under subsection 7(3) of these Regulations.
The following information about a unit that has not been assigned a registration number:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the unit’s name and, if any, civic address; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the unit’s geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude), expressed in decimal degrees to five decimal places.

Section.Text: The name, civic address, telephone number, email address and, if any, fax number of the performance test verifier.
Information demonstrating that the performance test verifier meets the requirements set out in subsection 6(3) of these Regulations.
The procedures followed by the performance test verifier to assess whether

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum gross power was measured at the electrical terminals of the unit’s generators; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the performance test was conducted in accordance with subsection 6(2) of these Regulations.

Section.Text: A statement by the performance test verifier that affirms that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum gross power was measured at the electrical terminals of the unit’s generators; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the performance test was conducted in accordance with subsection 6(2) of these Regulations.

Section.Text: The unit’s maximum gross power, expressed in MW, as determined by the performance test.
The unit’s most recent maximum continuous rating.
The date of the performance test.
The following information about the responsible person that is submitting the report:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its name and civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether it is the owner and whether it has the charge, management or control of the unit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the federal Business Number assigned to it by the Canada Revenue Agency, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its percentage of ownership interest in the unit, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number, email address and, if any, fax number of its authorized official; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number, email address and, if any, fax number of a contact person, if different from the authorized official.

Section.Text: The following information about the facility where the unit is located:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its name and, if any, civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude), expressed in decimal degrees to five decimal places;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of each owner or person that has the charge, management or control of the facility and the federal Business Number, if any, assigned to each of those persons by the Canada Revenue Agency; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a facility that transmits electricity to an electricity system and supplies useful thermal energy to a recipient facility,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and, if any, civic address of the recipient facility,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude) of the recipient facility, expressed in decimal degrees to five decimal places, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of each owner or person that has the charge, management or control of the recipient facility and the federal Business Number, if any, assigned to each of those persons by the Canada Revenue Agency.

Section.Text: The following information and documents about the unit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each responsible person for the unit, other than the responsible person referred to in section 1, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name and, if any, civic address,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of whether it is an owner and whether it has the charge, management or control of the unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its percentage of ownership interest in the unit, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the federal Business Number assigned to it by the Canada Revenue Agency, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the unit’s name and, if any, civic address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the unit’s geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude), expressed in decimal degrees to five decimal places;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, any National Pollutant Release Inventory identification number assigned by the Minister to the unit or the facility where it is located for the purposes of section 48 of the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, any identifiers assigned by the Minister to the unit or the facility where it is located for the purposes of the Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the electricity system operator;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the unit’s electricity generation capacity;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the electricity generation capacity was determined under paragraph 6(1)(a) of these Regulations, the unit’s maximum gross power and the performance test report prepared by the performance test verifier that contains the information set out in Schedule 1;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the unit’s most recent maximum continuous rating and the date on which it was reported to the electricity system operator;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the year in which subsection 9(1) and section 12 of these Regulations begin to apply in respect of the unit;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: if the responsible person has made an election under section 11 of these Regulations with respect to the unit, the date on which the information referred to in subsection 11(2) of these Regulations was submitted and the date elected as the unit’s end of prescribed life;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the unit’s commissioning date;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the name of each boiler and combustion engine in the unit and the date on which each boiler and combustion engine started operating;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the unit combusted coal during the previous calendar year;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the maximum continuous rating for the unit has increased by 15% or more from the maximum continuous rating reported for the unit in the registration report that was submitted in respect of the unit under subsection 7(1), paragraph 7(2)(a) or subsection 8(2) of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the unit is a boiler unit referred to in subsection 3(4) of the Regulations Limiting Carbon Dioxide Emissions from Natural Gas-fired Generation of Electricity that has an end of prescribed life after December 31, 2034, and, if so, the year of its end of prescribed life;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the unit produces useful thermal energy;

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number, if any, assigned to the unit by the Minister under subsection 4(2) of the Reduction of Carbon Dioxide Emissions from Coal-fired Generation of Electricity Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number, if any, assigned to the unit by the Minister under subsection 21(4) of the Regulations Limiting Carbon Dioxide Emissions from Natural Gas-fired Generation of Electricity;

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: if the unit is a subunit referred to in section 8 of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number, assigned by the Minister under subsection 7(3) of these Regulations, of each other subunit that was registered as one of the multiple subunits referred to in subsection 8(1) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of whether all of the conditions set out in subsection 8(1) of these Regulations are met,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the sum of the maximum continuous rating of the subunit and each other subunit that was registered as one of the multiple subunits referred to in subsection 8(1) of these Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of whether the sum of the maximum continuous rating for each of the subunits has increased by 15% or more from the sum of the maximum continuous ratings reported in the registration reports submitted for the subunits under subsection 8(2) of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (u)
Paragraph.Text: a process diagram of the facility where the unit is located that clearly identifies the assembly of equipment that constitutes the unit as well as

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: major equipment, including boilers, combustion engines, duct burners and other combustion devices, heat recovery systems, steam turbines, generators, emission control devices, carbon capture and storage system equipment and continuous emission monitoring systems,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the manner in which the equipment referred to in subparagraph (i) is physically connected and operates together,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the boundaries used to identify each unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the boundaries used to identify the unit that was registered as multiple subunits in accordance with subsection 8(1) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the electric flows that cross the boundary of a unit and those that cross the boundary of the facility,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the location of any electricity-measuring device,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the heat streams that cross the boundary of a unit and those that cross the boundary of the facility,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: if a carbon capture and storage system is shared between multiple units or other sources, information that identifies those units and sources, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, any major equipment that is physically connected with another facility and the name of that facility;

Paragraph.Label: (v)
Paragraph.Text: if the unit includes major equipment that is physically connected with another facility, the name of that facility and the name of the owner or person that has the charge, management or control of that facility;

Paragraph.Label: (w)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the unit is deemed, under subsection 5(2) of these Regulations, to meet the criterion set out in paragraph 5(1)(a) of these Regulations and, if so, the names and registration numbers, assigned by the Minister under subsection 7(3) of these Regulations, of the units for which the sum of the electricity generation capacity is at least 25 MW;

Paragraph.Label: (x)
Paragraph.Text: if the unit contains a combustion engine, boiler or steam turbine that was contained in another unit previously registered under these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number assigned to the previously registered unit by the Minister under subsection 7(3) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a combustion engine or steam turbine, the electricity generation capacity associated with the combustion engine or steam turbine, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the combustion engine, boiler or steam turbine started operating in the unit that is the subject of the report;

Paragraph.Label: (y)
Paragraph.Text: if the unit is a planned unit, information demonstrating that the unit is a planned unit and an explanation, along with supporting documents, of how each of the criteria set out in section 3 of these Regulations was met in relation to the unit, including the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the unit’s commissioning date is after December 31, 2025, a description of the plans for the unit as they existed on December 31, 2025,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if no impact assessment or environmental assessment was required in relation to the unit, a declaration to that effect and an explanation of why it was not required,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if an impact assessment or environmental assessment was required, an explanation of how the information submitted to the relevant authority on or before December 31, 2025 was all of the information required to initiate the relevant assessment and the date on which the information was submitted,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting the ownership or control, on or before December 31, 2025, of the land on which the unit is located,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting any permit required to begin construction of the unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an explanation of how the information submitted on or before December 31, 2025 in relation to any permit required to begin construction at the site where the unit is located was all the information required to obtain that permit and the date on which the information was submitted,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the value of the contracts referred to in subparagraph 3(a)(iv) of these Regulations and the date on which those contracts were entered into,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: details of the value of the equipment that is the subject of the contracts and an explanation of how that equipment is used in the unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting the construction of the unit, including the date on which construction began at the site where the unit is located, and

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: an explanation of how the unit is substantially the same on its commissioning date as the unit in relation to which the criteria set out in section 3 of these Regulations were met, including an indication of the electricity generation capacity that was planned for the unit on the date on which the unit met the criteria set out in that section; and

Paragraph.Label: (z)
Paragraph.Text: if the unit has been modified in a way that resulted in the creation of one or more units for which a registration report is required under paragraph 7(2)(a) of these Regulations, the registration number assigned to each of those units by the Minister under subsection 7(3) of these Regulations.

Section.Text: If the report is submitted in accordance with subsection 7(4) of these Regulations, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of the provisions of this Schedule to which the updated information relates;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the updated information; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the change.
